Purpura fulminans should be suspected when:

- '''Fever ([[Hyperthermia/fever SD-044|hyperthermia/fever]])'''

- Signs of haemodynamic failure ('''[[Discovery of arterial hypotension SD-043|hypotension]]''', mottling, polypnoea, collapse, oligoanuria, etc.).

- Neurological signs (obnubilation, coma, meningeal syndrome). Note that meningeal syndrome may be absent.

- Necrotic and/or ecchymotic and/or extensive purpura (physical examination to be carried out with the patient in underwear).

question.title: Question
question.description: When should Purpura fulminans be suspected?

option_a.title: Option A
option_a.description: When there is a history of recent vaccination

option_b.title: Option B
option_b.description: When there are signs of haemodynamic failure

option_c.title: Option C
option_c.description: When the patient has a history of bleeding disorders

option_d.title: Option D
option_d.description: When there is a family history of purpura

correct_option.title: Correct Option
correct_option.description: When there are signs of haemodynamic failure
